alert.note: Alert for Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 4:39PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Park and north central Teton Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 438 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gibbons Falls, or 13 miles northeast of Old Faithful, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Virginia Cascade and Norris Junction around 450 PM MDT. Canyon, Grebe Lake, Twin Lakes, Cascade Lake and Lower Falls around 455 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Obsidian Cliff, Grizzly Lake and Osprey Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.
